column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18656 (gui: Add a `Make unsigned` button next to `Send` by achow101)
* #18027 ("PSBT Operations" dialog by gwillen)
* #

Note to reviewers: previously `CoinControlDialog::updateLabels` was called with 2 different "dialogs" (`CoinControlDialog` and `SendCoinsDialog`) and both have the same set of labels except for `labelCoinControlInsuffFunds`. So, in order to remove static members and usages of `findChild`, most of the code of `updateLabels` is now duplicate.\n\nLet me know if you prefer the 2nd commit split. IMO

Travis seems to fail:

```c
qt/coincontroldialog.cpp: In member function â€˜void CoinControlDialog::updateView()â€™:
3030qt/coincontroldialog.cpp:607:84: error: invalid conversion from â€˜CoinControlDialog*â€™ to â€˜intâ€™ [-fpermissive]
3031         CCoinControlWidgetItem *itemWalletAddress = new CCoinControlWidgetItem(this);
3032
@jonasschnelli all fixed.
@Sjors good catch, will fix.
If `CoinControlDialog` was open once, the output list is not updated when new coins arrive.
@gwillen take a look at this?

Sorry for the delay, I am happy to take a look, but I'm getting the same build failure that Travis is seeing. Not sure why only some Travis builds get it and not others.\n\n(EDIT, I misread before:) Looks like a rebase refactored something and you need to update a callsite to match.
@gwillen I'll fix the build, sorry.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->\nðŸ™ This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
Created #18894 with just the fix. I'll submit the remaining changes later.
Assigning a parent to a `QDialog` widget changes its default location.\nIs it desirable?
Why not pass `model` to the `CoinControlDialog` constructor?
Notes for other reviewers from [Qt docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qdialog.html#exec):\n> Avoid using this [`exec()`] function; instead, use `open()`.
I can make that change, but I think it's unrelated here.
I think so, at least it looked fine to me.
As `updateLabels()` is a member function now, we could get rid of these intermediate variables (`lN`). Maybe scriptdiff?\nThis will improve code readability significantly.
We use the `setModel()` approach in various places where the model isn't known at construction time, but that's not the case here. But agree it's not really related.

I agree but I think that refactor, and others like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17457#discussion_r348318696, could come next.\n\nI'm also very tempted to fix other things, but I just want to ditch the static coin control to fix the issue.
@promag Agree with your point.
